isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Diagnostics Model Years 1999-2000 - ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM DIAGNOSTICS - Circuit Function And Diagnostics - Idle Shutdown Timer (IST)

svcsubproc.title: System Function
svcsubproc.para:
See Idle Shutdown Timer Function Diagram
.

figure.caption: Function Diagram for Idle Shutdown Timer

svcsubproc.para: The Idle Shutdown feature is a customer optional feature that allows the ECM to shut off the engine if an idle condition has been detected for more than the customer specified programmed period (2 to 120 minutes). Before engine shutdown the Oil / Water Lamp (red) will flash for 30 seconds to warn the driver of the pending shutdown. The idle time is measured from the last clutch or break pedal transition. The engine must be out of gear for the idle shutdown timer to be initiated. This feature can be programmed to operate at specific ambient air temperatures to allow prolonged engine operation in cold or hot weather operation. For PTO applications this feature can also be programmed not to be turned on under specific load levels or when the PTO switches are on.

svcsubproc.title: Fault Detection / Management
svcsubproc.para: The Idle Shutdown feature is internal to the ECM. All subsystems that are inputs for the idle shutdown strategy have their own Diagnostic Trouble Code detection and management strategy (e.g. IAT temperature sensor circuit). A Diagnostic Trouble Code will be set if the idle shutdown timer has been activated. This is not a system Diagnostic Trouble Code. It only indicates that the idle shutdown timer has been activated and that the engine has been shut down.

entry.para: 324 = Idle shutdown time has been exceeded and the engine has been shut down.

note.para: This Diagnostic Trouble Code does not indicate any system or circuit faults; no diagnostics are necessary. If the (IST) programming parameters need to be changed, see the following Extended Description.

svcsubproc.title: Extended Description
svcsubproc.para: The following list of parameters are essential to setting the IST function to meet the customer's needs and expectations. They are accessible by using the EST.

This group of parameters customizes the prolonged engine idle automatic shutdown feature. The purpose of this feature is to shut the engine down after a programmable period of idle time has been exceeded. This allows fuel conservation, a reduction of engine wear and emissions. Thirty (30.0) seconds before an automatic engine shutdown, the operator will be warned via the red Oil / Water Lamp. This lamp will begin flashing until the engine is shut down. The operator may over ride the electronics at any time. After an engine shutdown occurs, the Oil / Water Lamp will stop flashing and a diagnostic code (324) will be recorded. The diagnostic code is recorded to assist in diagnosing possible service complaints of the engine shutting down.
Currently, there are four states of electronic operation. 1. Off 2. PTO available 3. No engine load 4. Tamper proof.
This parameter indicates to the on-board electronics if this vehicle has the Idle Shutdown timer feature.
OFF: Feature is turned off at all times.
PTO Available: Feature allows prolonged engine idle shutdown only when the engine is in the low idle no load condition and PTO operation is off.
No Engine Load: Feature allows prolonged engine idle shutdown when the engine is in the low idle no load condition.
Tamper Proof: Feature is tamper proof from operator over ride.
This parameter indicates the length of engine idle time before the engine may be shut down.

para.emph: Maximum Intake Ambient Air Temperature (IAT) for Idle Shutdown

svcsubproc.para: This parameter indicates the maximum ambient intake air temperature that the on-board electronics may shut down during prolonged engine idling. This temperature is used to circumvent the shutting down of an engine when it is running because the air conditioning may be turned on.

step1.para: Minimum Intake Ambient Air Temperature( IAT) for Idle Shutdown

svcsubproc.para: This parameter indicates the minimum ambient intake air temperature that the on-board electronics may shut down during prolonged engine idling. This temperature is used to circumvent the shutting down of an engine when it is running because of cold ambient temperature.

para.emph: Idle Shutdown Timer Enabled Engine shutdown

svcsubproc.para: This Diagnostic Trouble Code is set when the engine has been shut off by the ECM because the idle time criteria has been exceeded. The idle shutdown feature should be turned on for this Diagnostic Trouble Code to be displayed. Diagnostic Trouble Code 324 can be cleared using the EST.
